nav.div: St. Bernard-Elmwood Place City Schools » Parents » Coronavirus Information

br.br:
Parents/Guardians,
Please see the attached information regarding the coronavirus (also called COVID-19 or 2019-nCoV).
Additional information will be posted as it becomes available.
Thank you!
Coronavirus Resources
Ohio Department of Health (Updated Daily)
What you need to know about Coronavirus
What to do if you are sick with Coronavirus
How to Talk to Your Children about Coronavirus
HotLine - If you have questions regarding Coronavirus/COVID-19, please call the Ohio Department of Health’s new call center: 1-833-4ASKODH (1-833-427-5634). The call center is open 7 days a week from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. The call center staff includes licensed nurses and infectious disease experts. They are available to answer questions and provide accurate information about COVID-19, the risk to the public, and the state’s response. Visit the Ohio Department’s of Health’s website for more information.
Extended Plan of Action from Superintendent, Dr. Mimi Webb - April 1, 2020
Plan of Action from Superintendent, Dr. Mimi Webb - March 17, 2020
Coronavirus Letter from Superintendent, Dr. Mimi Webb
Coronavirus Letter from Director of Business & Technology, Bruce Helwagen
Coronavirus Letter from School Nurse, Lori Dent, RN, BSN
Coronavirus Letter from Hamilton County Public Health
Open Enrollment Applications for 2020-21 - Date Change
St. Bernard-Elmwood Place Schools will accept open enrollment applications beginning Tuesday, April 14, 2020, at 8:00 a.m. through June 30, 2020, at 3:30 p.m., for the 2020-21 school year. Open enrollment forms must be submitted electronically to the Board of Education Office at 105 Washington Avenue in St. Bernard. The link will be available beginning April 14th.
